Class ec.e.openers.Opener 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.e.openers.Opener 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.openers.Opener
public class Opener
extends Object
The file Opener.java started out as ECReflect.java, attempting to mimic the functionality in the Jave 1.1. Reflection API, but became a capability-based set of abstractions for inspecting, encoding, & decoding sets of objects.

In 1.1, classes are used as type identifiers. The primitive data types (boolean, byte, char etc) are often "wrapped" in special classes (Boolean, Byte, Character etc) whenever we need to pass their values around freely as bona fide Objects. We keep a number of final variables around with the appropriate associations of wrapper class, signature, and human-readable string for all primitive data types.

The Opener classes are built to trust other Opener classes--full mutual trust. Therefore this set is defined only in this package, and is not extensible by subclassing. This is enforced by having no Opener constructor have greater than package scope. Openers are extensible instead by parameterization--mostly by defining new kinds of Recipes. This is the Semi-final Classes technique.

This package is the first test of some experimental coding conventions. Amusingly, the implementation uses a write-only variable to accomplish something useful.

See Also:

MIN_OPENER_LIBRARY_VERSION 
  public final static int MIN_OPENER_LIBRARY_VERSION
Opener native library version match verification. libraryVersion() returns a version number as an integer. We compare it to a range of library versions that we can handle. Version numbers use two last decimal digits as a "minor version" field.

  public final static int RELEASED_OPENER_LIBRARY_VERSION

staticSelfTest 
  public static void staticSelfTest()
staticSelfTest - checks this class and its static environment for certain expected inconsistencies. For now, we just check that we have loaded our native code library and that it is the version we expect it to be. If we find a problem, we throw an Error.
type 
  public abstract Class type()
Returns a Class for the type that this Opener opens. If this is an Opener for a scalar type, this will return the corresponding wrapping class type.
signature 
  public abstract String signature()
Signatures are according to the Java Virtual Machine Specification.
encodeItTo 
  public abstract void encodeItTo(Object obj,
                                  RtEncoder encoder) throws IOException
Encode 'obj' onto 'encoder' according to the type this Opener describes. Unwraps 'obj' as necessary.
Parameters:
obj - nullOk, suspect;
encoder - suspect;
decodeFrom 
  public abstract Object decodeFrom(RtDecoder decoder) throws IOException
Decode an object from 'decoder' according to the type this Opener describes. Wraps result as necessary.
Parameters:
decoder - suspect;
Returns:
nullOk, suspect;
